verse: Against Moab. Concerning Moab. Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel:
Be assured! The days are coming—oracle of the Lord—when I will send him wine-makers to decant the wine; they shall empty its flasks and smash its jars.
Chemosh shall disappoint Moab, just as the house of Israel was disappointed by Bethel, in which they trusted.
Judgment has come upon the plateau: on Holon, Jahzah, and Mephaath,
on Kerioth and on Bozrah: on all the cities of the land of Moab, far and near.
Make him drunk because he set himself over against the Lord; let Moab swim in his vomit and become a laughingstock.
Has Israel not been a laughingstock to you? Was he caught among thieves that you wag your heads whenever you speak of him?
The cry of Heshbon and Elealeh is heard as far as Jahaz; they call from Zoar to Horonaim and to Eglath-shelishiyah; even the waters of Nimrim turn into a wasteland.
I will leave no one in Moab—oracle of the Lord—to offer burnt offerings on the high place or to make sacrifices to their gods.
Hence my heart wails like a flute for Moab; my heart wails like a flute for the people of Kir-heres: the wealth they accumulated has perished.
Every head has been shaved bald, every beard cut off; every hand gashed, and all their loins are draped in sackcloth.
On all the rooftops of Moab and in all its squares there is mourning. I have shattered Moab like a pot that no one wants—oracle of the Lord.
How terrified they are, how they wail! How Moab turns its back in shame! Moab has become a laughingstock and a horror to all its neighbors!
